algorithms.mst

Class TourHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.mst.TourHandler

  • public class TourHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    class to handle path sum and edits of a tour, used by TSPPrimsMST. NOTE, the method and class are meant for single threaded use only due to time and memory saving internal variable use.
    Author:
    nichole

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      TourHandler(int[] theTour, gnu.trove.map.TIntObjectMap<gnu.trove.map.TIntIntMap> theAdjacencyCostMap, algorithms.util.PairInt[] theCoordinates)
      constructor for tour handler.

      given tour values (which are the original graph vertexes), change to vertexIdxs1 and return the updated pathSum.
      gnu.trove.list.TIntList findIntersectingEdges(int idxEdgeAVertex1)
      given first index n the reference frame of vertex indexes, find the edges in the tour that it intersects with and return the list of indexes in format edge A vertex 1 index, edge A vertex 2 index, edge B vertex 1 index, edge B vertex 2 index, edge C vertex 1 index, edge C vertex 2 index, etc where edge A is idxEdgeAVertex1 and the item that follows it in the tour.
      protected int findMinValidBestSwap(int idxEdgeAVertex1, int idxEdgeAVertex2, int idxEdgeBVertex1, int idxEdgeBVertex2, int[] outputVertexIdxs)
      given first indexes of edge1 and edge2 in tour but in the reference frame of vertex indexes, find which swap among the 2 pairs produces the shortest path and return the pathSum and populate outputIndexes with the suggested swap indexes.

        constructor for tour handler. Note that theTour is not copied, and is modified by changePaths().

    • Method Detail

      • findIntersectingEdges

        public gnu.trove.list.TIntList findIntersectingEdges(int idxEdgeAVertex1)
        given first index n the reference frame of vertex indexes, find the edges in the tour that it intersects with and return the list of indexes in format edge A vertex 1 index, edge A vertex 2 index, edge B vertex 1 index, edge B vertex 2 index, edge C vertex 1 index, edge C vertex 2 index, etc where edge A is idxEdgeAVertex1 and the item that follows it in the tour.
        Parameters:
        idxEdgeAVertex1 - edge A vertex 1 index, the second edge index is implicitly the one that follows this in the tour array.
        Returns:
        the list of indexes in format edge A vertex 1 index, edge A vertex 2 index, edge B vertex 1 index, edge B vertex 2 index, edge C vertex 1 index, edge C vertex 2 index, etc where edge A is idxEdgeAVertex1 and the item that follows it in the tour.

      • modifyTourIntersectingEdges

        public void modifyTourIntersectingEdges()

      • findMinValidBestSwap

        protected int findMinValidBestSwap(int idxEdgeAVertex1,
                                   int idxEdgeAVertex2,
                                   int idxEdgeBVertex1,
                                   int idxEdgeBVertex2,
                                   int[] outputVertexIdxs)
        given first indexes of edge1 and edge2 in tour but in the reference frame of vertex indexes, find which swap among the 2 pairs produces the shortest path and return the pathSum and populate outputIndexes with the suggested swap indexes. NOTE, the method and class are meant for single threaded use only - there are reserved cache variables used without synchronization or mutexes.
        Parameters:
        idxEdgeAVertex1 - edge A vertex 1 index, the second edge index is implicitly the one that follows this in the tour array.
        idxEdgeAVertex2 - edge A vertex 3 index, the second edge index that follows idxEdgeAVertex1 in the tour array.
        idxEdgeBVertex1 - edge B vertex 1 index, the second edge index is implicitly the one that follows this in the tour array.
        idxEdgeBVertex2 - edge B vertex 3 index, the second edge index that follows idxEdgeBVertex1 in the tour array.
        outputVertexIdxs - array of size 4 holding the combination of vertexes that result in best path sum.
        Returns:
        best path sum for a combination of swapping edge vertexes between the 2 edges given else -1 if a better combination than current was not found.

      • peekSumPathChanges

        protected int peekSumPathChanges(int tIdxPrevA1,
                                 int tIdxA1,
                                 int tIdxA2,
                                 int tIdxNextA2,
                                 int tIdxPrevB1,
                                 int tIdxB1,
                                 int tIdxB2,
                                 int tIdxNextB2,
                                 int tIdx1,
                                 int tIdx2,
                                 int tIdx3,
                                 int tIdx4)
        given tour indexes A1, A2, B1, B2 and the vertexes to change those to, calculate what the path sum would be with those changes, but do not apply the changes. The tour indexes before and after edgeA and edgeB are passed in to avoid recalculating. The invoking method has the responsibility of passing valid arguments to this method.
        Parameters:
        tIdxPrevA1 - is the tour index before that containing vertexIdxs0[0].
        tIdxA1 - tour index for first point of edgeA
        tIdxA2 - tour index for last point of edgeA
        tIdxNextA2 - is the tour index after that containing vertexIdxs0[1]
        tIdxPrevB1 - is the tour index before that containing vertexIdxs0[2]
        tIdxB1 - tour index for first point of edgeB
        tIdxB2 - tour index for last point of edgeB
        tIdxNextB2 - is the tour index after that containing vertexIdxs0[3]
        tIdx1 - candidate change edge A vertex1 tour index
        tIdx2 - candidate change edge A vertex2 tour index
        tIdx3 - candidate change edge B vertex1 tour index
        tIdx4 - candidate change edge B vertex2 tour index
        Returns:
        the calculated path sum for the path changed from vertexes vertexIdxs0 to vertexIdxs1.

      • peekSumPathChangesReverseEdge

        protected int peekSumPathChangesReverseEdge(int tIdxPrevA1,
                                            int tIdxA1,
                                            int tIdxA2,
                                            int tIdxNextA2)
        given tour indexes A1, A2, B1, B2 and the vertexes to change those to, calculate what the path sum would be with those changes, but do not apply the changes. The tour indexes before and after edgeA and edgeB are passed in to avoid recalculating. The invoking method has the responsibility of passing valid arguments to this method.
        Parameters:
        tIdxPrevA1 - is the tour index before that containing vertexIdxs0[0].
        tIdxA1 - tour index for first point of edgeA
        tIdxA2 - tour index for last point of edgeA
        tIdxNextA2 - is the tour index after that containing vertexIdxs0[1]
        Returns:
        the calculated path sum for the path changed from vertexes vertexIdxs0 to vertexIdxs1.

      • changePaths

        public int changePaths(int idxEdgeAVertex1,
                       int idxEdgeBVertex1,
                       int[] vertexIdxs)
        given tour values (which are the original graph vertexes), change to vertexIdxs1 and return the updated pathSum.
        Parameters:
        idxEdgeAVertex1 - edge A vertex 1 index, the second edge index is implicitly the one that follows this in the tour array.
        idxEdgeBVertex1 - edge B vertex 1 index, the second edge index is implicitly the one that follows this in the tour array.
        vertexIdxs - the vertexes to change edge A and edge B to in thr tour
        Returns:
        the updated path sum after the changes are applied.

      • changePathsToReverseEdge

        public int changePathsToReverseEdge(int tIdxA1)
        given tour values (which are the original graph vertexes), change to vertexIdxs1 and return the updated pathSum.
        Parameters:
        tIdxA1 - edge A vertex 1 tour index, the second edge index is implicitly the one that follows this in the tour array.
        Returns:
        the updated path sum after the changes are applied.

      • getTourIndex

        public int getTourIndex(int vertexIdx)
        given the original graph vertex index, return the index of that point in the tour. Note that if the result is 0, the vertex is also present as the last item of the tour, but that index is not returned.
        Parameters:
        vertexIdx -
        Returns:
